command: $ErrorActionPreference='Stop'; $pscp='pscp.exe'; $log="$env:ProgramData\NetAdmin\logs\T1597.log"; $host='sftp.team-cymru.com'; $user=$env:CYMRU_USER; $key=$env:CYMRU_PPK; $hostkey=$env:CYMRU_HOSTKEY; $remote='/bulk/ip2asn/2025-09/ip2asn-2025-09.csv.gz'; $dest='C:\Intel\TeamCymru\ip2asn-2025-09.csv.gz'; New-Item -ItemType Directory -Path (Split-Path $dest) -Force | Out-Null; try { & $pscp -scp -batch -q -C -P 22 -i $key -hostkey $hostkey "$user@$host:$remote" "$dest"; if($LASTEXITCODE -ne 0){ throw "pscp exit code $LASTEXITCODE" }; $hash=(Get-FileHash -Algorithm SHA256 -Path $dest).Hash; $status=[pscustomobject]@{ technique='T1597'; source=$host; remote_path=$remote; local_path=$dest; sha256=$hash; success=$true; ts=(Get-Date).ToString('o') } } catch { $status=[pscustomobject]@{ technique='T1597'; source=$host; remote_path=$remote; local_path=$dest; success=$false; error=$_.Exception.Message; ts=(Get-Date).ToString('o') } } finally { $json=$status|ConvertTo-Json -Compress; New-Item -ItemType Directory -Path (Split-Path $log) -Force | Out-Null; Add-Content -Path $log -Value $json; Write-Output $json }
explanation: Pulls a subscription IP-to-ASN mapping dataset from Team Cymru via SCP, verifying integrity and emitting a JSON audit record.
rationale_steps: Access a restricted commercial dataset with SSH key authentication.
Transfer only a targeted monthly file to minimize operational footprint.
Hash and log the acquisition for provenance and future validation.
No engagement with open sources; strictly closed-source collection.

llm_judgments.syntactic_justification: The PowerShell command is perfectly well-formed with proper variable declarations, error handling via try/catch/finally blocks, balanced quotes/braces, and correct command separators.
llm_judgments.semantic_justification: The command perfectly aligns with T1597 (Search Closed Sources) by retrieving subscription-based threat intelligence data from Team Cymru (a closed source), with proper authentication, logging, and verification mechanisms.

llm_judgments.syntactic_justification: The command is perfectly well-formed PowerShell, utilizing correct variable assignments, cmdlet syntax, external executable calling, conditional logic, and robust error handling with proper quoting and flag usage.
llm_judgments.semantic_justification: The command perfectly aligns with T1597 by acquiring a specific, potentially subscription-based intelligence dataset (IP-to-ASN mapping from Team Cymru) from a closed source via a secure transfer protocol (SCP), which is a highly plausible and realistic adversary action for intelligence gathering.

llm_judgments.syntactic_justification: Well-formed PowerShell with balanced quoting and parentheses, valid separators, and plausible pscp flags, plus correctly structured try/catch/finally and JSON logging.
llm_judgments.semantic_justification: It authenticates to a closed Team Cymru endpoint to acquire a subscription dataset via SCP, verifies the file hash, and records an audit JSON, matching T1597’s use of paid/private sources.
